bomberman.core.logic
Class EntityEngine

java.lang.Object
  bomberman.core.logic.EntityEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContactListener
public class EntityEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContactListener

The class for managing the interaction of Entity instances via the. Box2d physics engine. This class provides thread-safe access for adding and removing objects during game play and also handles drawing all of the objects on screen.

This class is partially based on the playn-peaphysics example (Copyright 2011 The PlayN Authors), which is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0.

          Box2d object containing physics world
 
Constructor Summary
private EntityEngine()
          Creates a new EntityEngine that manages the Box2d physical world and physical state of all objects in the game, wrapping most of the logic for interacting with Box2D.

private EntityEngine()

beginContact

public void beginContact(Contact contact)
Called when Box2d finishes recording the contact between two DynamicPhysicsEntity.

Specified by:
beginContact in interface ContactListener
Parameters:
contact - the contact Body instances, records the contact in this instance's list of contacts to process during update(int).

clearWorld

public void clearWorld()
Clear the Box2D world removing all bodies and fixtures contained in it (including the ground bodies}.

doAdd

private void doAdd(Entity entity)
Adds the entity o the list of entities and optionally registers the entity with the physics engine. This method is private, as it is only called during the update(int) method to ensure a consistent state where entities are not added during painting.

Parameters:
entity - the entity

doRemove

private void doRemove(Entity entity)
Removes the Entity from the list of entities managed by this engine, unregistering it with the physics engine if necessary. This method is private to ensure that entities are only removed in a consistent manner at once.

Parameters:
entity - the entity

endContact

public void endContact(Contact contact)
Called when Box2d finishes recording the contact release between two DynamicPhysicsEntity.

Specified by:
endContact in interface ContactListener
Parameters:
contact - the contact Body instances, records the contact in this instance's list of contacts to process during update(int).

getWorld

public World getWorld()
Returns the Box2d World in which objects interact. This method is intended only for entities that need to initialize their state later and then add themselves to the world.

Returns:
the World
